title: Centre of Innovation in IoT lab set up at GITAM - The Hindu
summary:
Centre of Innovation in IoT Lab Established at GITAM

Published: December 18, 2024 08:07 am IST

Source: GITAM News

The USA-based semiconductor company, Silicon Labs, has partnered with GITAM Deemed to be University to set up a Centre of Innovation in IoT, aimed at fostering student engagement in the IoT and semiconductor fields.

  • Silicon Labs will provide hardware kits, software tools, and technical support.
  • GITAM will supply the lab space and dedicated faculty.
  • The initiative aims to enhance students' skills for future careers in IoT and semiconductor industries.
  • The MoU was signed in a ceremony attended by university officials and Silicon Labs representatives.
Mr. Venkatesh emphasized the lab's focus on product development and the value of skills gained by students.

This collaboration is poised to significantly impact students' career readiness and promote innovation in IoT technologies.
newTitle: Centre of Innovation in IoT Lab Established at GITAM

title: Buy iPhone 16 under Rs 73,000: How to grab this special Amazon deal - India TV News
summary:
Buy iPhone 16 under Rs 73,000: How to grab this special Amazon deal

Publication Date: December 2024 Source: India TV News

This year, the biggest announcement was the launch of the iPhone 16 at a surprisingly lower price, now listed at a discounted rate on Amazon India, making it an attractive option for buyers.

Key Points:

  • The iPhone 16 (128GB) is available for Rs 77,400, with an instant discount bringing the price to Rs 72,400 for select bank users.
  • The 256GB variant of the iPhone 15 is similarly priced, offering multiple options.
  • This is an ideal time for upgrades to the AI-powered iPhone 16.

iPhone 16: Features and specifications

  1. 6.1-inch Super Retina XDR display.
  2. A18 Bionic chip for fast performance.
  3. Runs on iOS 18.
  4. 48MP main camera with telephoto zoom.
  5. 12MP front camera with enhanced processing.
  6. Improved battery life and USB Type-C fast charging support.

This deal is exclusively available on Amazon India, making it perfect for anyone looking to upgrade or join the Apple ecosystem.
newTitle: Buy iPhone 16 under Rs 73,000: How to grab this special Amazon deal

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra to win the bezel game - GSMArena.com news - GSMArena.com
Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra 5G now available at half price: Massive discount revealed - India TV News
summary:
Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra 5G Now Available at Half Price: Massive Discount Revealed

Date & Source: December 2024, India TV News

The Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra 5G has received a significant price reduction, making it a compelling buy for consumers. Initially launched at Rs 1,49,999, the device is now priced at Rs 76,999 on Amazon India, along with several purchasing benefits.

  • Initial launch price: Rs 1,49,999; current price: Rs 76,999.
  • Additional benefits include bank discounts, no-cost EMI options, and an exchange offer up to Rs 53,200.
  • EMI starts at Rs 3,733.
  • The smartphone features a 6.81-inch Dynamic AMOLED display with a 2X resolution and 120Hz refresh rate.
  • Powerful Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 processor with 12GB RAM.
  • Up to 1TB storage and features S-Pen support.
  • 200MP primary camera alongside three additional lenses.
  • 12MP front camera and 5000mAh battery with 45W charging support.

Quote:

The Galaxy S23 Ultra makes cutting-edge technology accessible at a fraction of the original cost.

This discounted pricing could encourage a wider customer base to explore premium smartphone features.
newTitle: Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra 5G Now Available at Half Price: Massive Discount Revealed

Samsung Galaxy S25 Plus Images Just Leaked Ahead of Rumored Unpacked Event

The Samsung Galaxy S25 Plus has had leaked images surface, offering a glimpse into its design just ahead of the expected Unpacked event. This leak stands out amidst numerous rumors regarding the flagship models.

  • Trio of leaked images shows the familiar design of the S25 Plus.
  • The design features rounded corners, similar to the Galaxy S24 and S24 Plus.
  • Samsung continues to face accusations of designing devices that resemble Apple's aesthetic.
  • Rumors suggest enhancements in performance with the Snapdragon 8 Elite chip.
  • This leak also reveals that the upcoming Galaxy S25 Plus will have minor feature adjustments rather than major redesigns compared to the Ultra model.
“Samsung has been accused of copying Apple and the iPhone in the last few generations.”

The leaks indicate a continuation of Samsung's design philosophy and hint at the anticipated performance improvements. Fans await the official reveal during the Unpacked event.

Nvidia’s Upcoming RTX 50 Series Graphics Cards with Neural Rendering Features

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Various

Nvidia is expected to reveal its RTX 50 series graphics cards at CES 2025, featuring advanced AI capabilities, including Neural Rendering, which may transform graphics processing and display.

  • Nvidia's RTX 50 series likely includes up to five new graphics cards.
  • New AI feature: Neural Rendering is aimed at enhancing graphics processing.
  • Inno3D announces intention to highlight Nvidia AI features at CES.
  • Cards may include advanced DLSS technology, potentially introducing DLSS 4.0.

title: Google launches Whisk AI-image generator: How is different from others - The Times of India
summary:
Google Launches Whisk AI-Image Generator: What Sets It Apart?

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Tech News Daily

Google has introduced its latest AI-image generator, Whisk, which aims to revolutionize the way users create images. This article explores the unique features of Whisk compared to other AI-image generators currently available.

  • Whisk leverages advanced neural networks for more realistic image creation.
  • It allows users to specify detailed attributes for images, enhancing customization.
  • Whisk integrates seamlessly with other Google services, improving accessibility and usability.
  • The generator is designed for both amateur and professional users, ensuring versatility.
"Whisk represents a significant leap forward in AI technology, making image creation more intuitive than ever before." - Google Spokesperson

In conclusion, Whisk is set to redefine the landscape of AI image generation, providing users with unprecedented control and creativity.
newTitle: Google Launches Whisk AI Image Generator: What Sets It Apart?

title: OpenAI brings its o1 reasoning model to its API — for certain developers - TechCrunch
summary:
OpenAI brings its o1 reasoning model to its API — for certain developers

Publication Date: September 12, 2024 | Source: TechCrunch

OpenAI is introducing its new “reasoning” AI model, o1, to its API, beginning with select developers in its “tier 5” category. This development allows for improved fact-checking capabilities, albeit with higher costs and longer processing times compared to previous models.

  • o1 will roll out to developers who spend at least $1,000 with OpenAI.
  • It replaces the o1-preview model and offers enhanced customization features.
  • OpenAI charges $15 for analysis and $60 for generation per ~750,000 words.
  • The model is designed to provide more accurate responses, particularly for programming and business inquiries.
  • OpenAI plans to expand access to additional usage tiers soon.
“We are rolling out access incrementally while working to expand access to additional usage tiers and ramping up rate limits,” OpenAI stated.

This launch demonstrates OpenAI's commitment to advancing AI capabilities while also addressing the demand for more powerful and customizable tools for developers.
newTitle: OpenAI Launches o1 Reasoning Model in API for Select Developers

title: Samsung Galaxy S25+ live photos show a familiar design - GSMArena.com news - GSMArena.com
Google DeepMind Leads the AGI Race, Outpaces OpenAI and Rivals - AIM
summary:
Google DeepMind Leads the AGI Race, Outpaces OpenAI and Rivals

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: Analytics India Magazine

Google DeepMind is advancing in the artificial general intelligence (AGI) race, overtaking OpenAI and other competitors with their new models, Veo 2 and Imagen 3. Scheduled for API release early next year, these models promise significant improvements in video generation features.

  • Google has launched two models, Veo 2 and Imagen 3, with impressive generative capabilities.
  • Veo 2 is reported to outperform competitors like OpenAI's Sora in quality and prompt adherence.
  • It features advanced cinematic understanding and improved detail in visuals.
  • Google's integration of Veo 2 into YouTube gives it competitive advantages in model training.
  • Veo 2 supports 4K resolution with longer video durations compared to previous models.
  • The development is expected to accelerate the path towards AGI, leading to significant advancements by 2025.
“Veo 2 delivers lifelike visuals with enhanced realism... it’s a significant improvement over current state-of-the-art models.” - Tom Hume, Google DeepMind

This rapid evolution in AI technologies indicates Google's strong commitment and strategic positioning in the AGI field.
newTitle: Google DeepMind Leads the AGI Race, Outpaces OpenAI and Rivals

title: What was the best Android phone of 2024? [Poll] - 9to5Google
summary:

2024 has been an excellent year for Android phones, prompting a public poll to determine the favorite device among consumers. The articles suggest strong contenders such as the Google Pixel 9 series, OnePlus 12, and Honor Magic V3.

  • The consensus indicates a preference towards the Google Pixel 9 series.
  • OnePlus 12 is lauded for its value and performance.
  • Honor Magic V3 is recognized for its thinness and camera quality but criticized for its update policy and availability.

"Google has nailed the fundamentals and made yet another solid phone – but with even higher hopes for the Pixel 10."

The article encourages readers to participate in the poll to voice their opinion on the best Android device of the year.

OnePlus 13 Global Launch Set for January 7 with Enhanced Water Resistance

Publication Date: October 15, 2023 Source: 9to5Google

The OnePlus 13 is highly anticipated and set for a global release on January 7, 2025. It showcases significant upgrades including a new design, enhanced battery life, and improved water resistance.

  • Launch Date: January 7, 2025
  • Features a 6,000mAh battery and flat display
  • Powered by Snapdragon 8 Elite SoC with OxygenOS 15
  • IP69 certified water resistance allows submersion in high temperatures
  • New color options include Midnight Ocean, Black Eclipse, and Arctic Dawn
  • OnePlus Buds 3 Pro will have a new Sapphire Blue colorway
  • Launch coincides with CES 2025
“The OnePlus 13 will be one of the few devices with the new IP69 standard.”

The upcoming launch of the OnePlus 13 promises upgraded features that cater to both performance and durability, positioning it as a strong contender in the flagship smartphone market.

title: Google DeepMind Leads the AGI Race, Outpacing OpenAI and Rivals - AIM
summary:
Google DeepMind Leads the AGI Race, Outpacing OpenAI and Rivals

Publication Date: N/A Source: N/A

Google has unveiled its latest generative AI models, Veo 2 and Imagen 3, aiming to outpace OpenAI and other competitors in the race to achieve Artificial General Intelligence (AGI).

  • OpenAI's CEO recently highlighted the significance of video in realizing AGI with the launch of Sora.
  • Google's Veo models perform exceptionally well in internal tests, outperforming rivals in quality and adherence to prompts.
  • The models handle complex video elements like reflections and shadows with improved clarity.
  • Veo 2 features advanced cinematic understanding, achieving lifelike visuals with reduced artifacts.
  • The model will be available through API by early next year, offering various enhancements over its predecessor.
  • Google leverages its YouTube platform for training models, giving it a competitive edge.
“It’s not perfect, but it’s a significant improvement over current state-of-the-art models.” - Shlomi Fruchter, Veo co-lead at Google DeepMind

As Google accelerates its agenda towards AGI, the firm continues to make significant strides and innovations in generative AI technologies, marking a pivotal moment in the tech landscape.
newTitle: Google DeepMind Leads the AGI Race, Outpacing OpenAI and Rivals

title: Google Extends Reach of AI Coding Tools to Third-Party DevOps Platforms - DevOps.com
summary:
Google Extends Reach of AI Coding Tools to Third-Party DevOps Platforms

Date: Today

Source: DevOps.com

Google has previewed new extensions to its AI coding tools for integration within development environments, aiming to enhance productivity for developers.

  • The new AI tools are based on the Gemini 2.0 Flash large language model.
  • Integration partners include Atlassian, GitHub, GitLab, Google Docs, and others.
  • AI tools simplify tasks such as summarizing comments, tracking merges, and identifying site issues.
  • Natural language commands can convert to API calls, secured by OAuth framework.
  • A survey indicated 33% of organizations use AI in software building; 42% are considering it.
  • Only 9% have fully integrated AI into DevOps pipelines.
Mitch Ashley, VP at The Futurum Group, stated, "While much of the early AI focus has been on code generation, most productivity benefits will come from automating adjacent tasks."

In conclusion, while AI coding tools promise increased productivity, the question of quality and thorough review remains crucial for successful integration in production environments.
newTitle: Google Expands AI Coding Tools to Third-Party Platforms

Samsung teases AI summary for One UI 7’s ‘Now Bar,’ powered by ‘Personal Data Engine’ - 9to5Google
summary:
Samsung Introduces AI-Powered Now Bar in One UI 7

Publication Date: December 16, 2024 | Source: 9to5Google

Samsung is preparing to launch the Galaxy S25 series while detailing enhancements such as a Personal Data Engine and AI summary feature for the Now Bar in One UI 7.

  • One UI 7 is based on Android 15 and in public beta phase.
  • The Now Bar serves as a new notification system that consolidates app information.
  • The Personal Data Engine enhances Knox security, employing post-quantum cryptography.
  • The Now Bar can create a personalized AI summary, such as travel recommendations and suggestions.
  • Samsung aims to make this feature highly useful through AI-driven suggestions.
“If Samsung can pull this sort of feature off... it would be a huge addition to the Galaxy lineup.”

In conclusion, Samsung’s introduction of AI features in One UI 7 marks a significant step forward in personalized smartphone experiences.
newTitle: Samsung Introduces AI-Powered Now Bar in One UI 7

Google Launches New Gemini Model Designed for Agentic AI Use Cases - Acceleration Economy
summary:
Google Launches New Gemini Model Designed for Agentic AI Use Cases

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Cloud Wars

In recent months, there has been significant activity around agentic AI, focusing on the technologies that power these advances. Google has unveiled Gemini 2.0, an AI model designed for agentic tasks, enhancing environmental awareness and capabilities for automated actions.

Key Features of Gemini 2.0 Flash

  • Native user interface action-capabilities
  • Multimodal reasoning
  • Long context understanding
  • Complex instruction following and planning
  • Compositional function-calling
  • Native tool use
  • Improved performance

Developers can access Gemini 2.0 Flash through Google AI Studio and Vertex AI.

General Availability of Trillium

Google announced that Trillium TPUs, which helped train Gemini 2.0, are now generally available for Google Cloud customers.

“The advancements in scale, speed, and cost-efficiency are significant.” - Barak Lenz, CTO, AI21 Labs

Closing Thoughts

With the development of Gemini, Google continues to solidify its position in the agentic AI space, paving the way for future advancements.
newTitle: Google Launches New Gemini Model Designed for Agentic AI Use Cases

summary:
Motorola unveils Moto G15, G15 Power and Moto G05 with big batteries

Publication Date: Today, Source: Motorola News

Motorola unveiled three new additions to its Moto G lineup today. The Moto G15, Moto G15 Power, and Moto G05 are entry-level phones boasting significant battery capacity and the latest Android 15 software.

  • The Moto G15 Power features a 6,000 mAh battery, while the G15 has a 5,200 mAh capacity.
  • Both G15 variants share a 6.72" Full HD+ LCD, 50 MP main camera, and 5 MP ultrawide camera.
  • The Moto G05 includes a 64 GB or 128 GB storage option with a smaller 6.67" HD+ LCD.
  • All models come with dual SIM support, a 3.5 mm audio jack, and various color options.
“Motorola has yet to share any details about pricing or launch dates, but confirms international availability.”

Motorola continues to expand its Moto G series, catering to users seeking powerful battery life and essential smartphone features.
newTitle: Motorola Unveils New Moto G15 Series with Impressive Battery Life
